questions.question: 1. What is the function of a controlled bridge rectifier?

answers.a: To convert AC voltage to DC voltage

questions.question: 2. Which of the following devices is controllable with firing pulses?
3. The firing angle in a controlled bridge rectifier determines:

answers.a: The frequency of the output waveform
answers.b: The peak value of the output voltage
answers.c: The phase delay between the AC input and the DC output
answers.d: The capacitance of the filter capacitor

questions.question: 4. Which of the following scheme is more appropriate to realize desired output voltage in  a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier?

answers.c: Varying the firing angle of the thyristors
answers.d: Changing the number of diodes in the bridge

questions.question: 5. The main advantage of using a single-phase controlled bridge rectifier over a single-phase uncontrolled rectifier is:

answers.c: Ability to control the output voltage
